title: China Construction Bank provides $39.5 million loan for Libreville Sports Palace Construction Project
description: In 2018, the Government of Gabon and China Construction Bank signed a $39,588,698 (CFA 19,794,349,018) loan agreement for the Libreville Sports Palace Construction Project. The loan carries a 5.8% interest rate. The other borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that the borrower was expected to use the loan proceeds to finance a commercial (EPC) contract between China State Construction Engineering Corporation (CSCEC) and the Gabonese Ministry of Youth and Sports, which was signed on April 27, 2017.   The purpose of the project was to design and construct a sports palace (handball stadium) with 5,493 seats in the city of Libreville. The exact locational coordinates of the stadium are 0.3947, 9.4529. The project site had a total construction area of ​​12,800 square meters.   CSCEC was the EPC contractor responsible for implementation. Construction began on May 16, 2017, and reached completion on December 25, 2017. The project officially achieved 'completion acceptance' on January 15, 2018, and it was officially handed over to the local authorities on January 16, 2018. The construction of the facility was undertaken on an expedited basis to ensure that it could be used for the 2018 African Men's Handball Championship (which took place from 17 to 27 January 2018 in Gabon).   On December 26, 2018, Gabon’s Minister of the Economy, Prospective and Development Programming reported to the Gabonese Senate that CSCEC had 'pre-financed the [construction of the stadium] while awaiting the availability of the financing requested from the China Construction Bank Corporation (CCB)'. In the third quarter of 2020, CCB made a loan disbursement worth CFA 1.109 billion.  There are some indications that the China Construction Bank loan for the Libreville Sports Palace Construction Project may have financially underperformed vis-a-vis the original expectations of the lender.  In mid-2014, a decline in international oil prices generated sharp reductions in Gabon’s oil exports and fiscal revenues. The country’s rising fiscal deficit led to the accumulation of arrears to external creditors. By 2017, the stock of the Government of Gabon’s external arrears stood at $115 million, including arrears to China, Canada, Germany, Spain, France, Israel, and South Korea. All of these arrears were successfully cleared by 2020. However, the Government of Gabon accumulated $3 million of additional arrears to Chinese creditors in 2020.  By the end of May 2021, ‘the stock of [the Government of] Gabon’s external arrears stood at CFAF 98.03 billion (US$182.1 million), including CFAF 23.8 billion (US$44.2 million) vis-à-vis multilaterals and CFAF 21.05 billion (US$39.1 million) vis-à-vis government agencies and private creditors insured with companies from Paris Club member countries and from China [ICBC and China Construction Bank] CFAF 1.3 billion (US$2.42 million). The Government's strategy for the clearance of existing external arrears consists of focusing primarily on multilateral debt, bilateral debt, insured commercial commitments and seeking agreements with other creditors prior to the IMF Board meeting. Accordingly, we will clear the arrears vis-à-vis the multilaterals. We will also clear bilateral and commercial-insured arrears as follows: (i) Austria CFAF 6.83 billion (US$12.69 million); (ii) France CFAF 11.9 billion (US$22.11 million); (iii) Israel CFAF 2.23 billion (US$4.13 million); and Spain CFAF 0.09 billion (US$0.17 million). Regarding the other commercial arrears vis-à-cis AFREXIMBANK (CFAF 7.52 billion or US$13.97 million, and commercial non-insured vis-à-vis France CFAF 0.7 billion (US$1.24 million), Austria CFAF 8.71 billion (US$16.18 million), and Morocco CFAF 1.01 billion (US$1.87 million), we contacted these creditors individually to obtain from them the non-objection agreement. The same communication was made with China to which our bilateral payment arrears are about CFAF 34.01 billion (US$63.17 million).’ Then, in 2022, the IMF reported that the Government of Gabon’s external arrears to Chinese creditors stood at $23.9 million as of December 2021 and $1 million in June 2022.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the Handball Stadium Construction Project. The Chinese project title is 加蓬利伯维尔手球馆项目 or 加蓬利伯维尔体育馆项目. The French project title is CONCEPTION ET CONSTRUCTION PALAIS DES SPORTS LBV or CONSTRUCTION DU GYMNASE OMNISPORT DE LBV or le projet « Construction Palais des Sports ». 2. This China Eximbank loan is not included in the database of Chinese loan commitments that SAIS-CARI released in July 2020.3. The loan's interest rate is identified in the World Bank's Debtor Reporting System (DRS). See https://www.dropbox.com/s/ab8qt4n6jijcbhd/IDS_Average%20interest%20on%20new%20external%20debt%20commitments.xlsx?dl=0 and https://www.dropbox.com/s/2sw4f7gluxa52fk/DRS%20Official%20Commitments%20from%20China%20Through%202021.xlsx?dl=0
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
China Construction Bank provides $39.5 million loan for Libreville Sports Palace Construction Project

# Description
In 2018, the Government of Gabon and China Construction Bank signed a $39,588,698 (CFA 19,794,349,018) loan agreement for the Libreville Sports Palace Construction Project. The loan carries a 5.8% interest rate. The other borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that the borrower was expected to use the loan proceeds to finance a commercial (EPC) contract between China State Construction Engineering Corporation (CSCEC) and the Gabonese Ministry of Youth and Sports, which was signed on April 27, 2017.   The purpose of the project was to design and construct a sports palace (handball stadium) with 5,493 seats in the city of Libreville. The exact locational coordinates of the stadium are 0.3947, 9.4529. The project site had a total construction area of ​​12,800 square meters.   CSCEC was the EPC contractor responsible for implementation. Construction began on May 16, 2017, and reached completion on December 25, 2017. The project officially achieved 'completion acceptance' on January 15, 2018, and it was officially handed over to the local authorities on January 16, 2018. The construction of the facility was undertaken on an expedited basis to ensure that it could be used for the 2018 African Men's Handball Championship (which took place from 17 to 27 January 2018 in Gabon).   On December 26, 2018, Gabon’s Minister of the Economy, Prospective and Development Programming reported to the Gabonese Senate that CSCEC had 'pre-financed the [construction of the stadium] while awaiting the availability of the financing requested from the China Construction Bank Corporation (CCB)'. In the third quarter of 2020, CCB made a loan disbursement worth CFA 1.109 billion.  There are some indications that the China Construction Bank loan for the Libreville Sports Palace Construction Project may have financially underperformed vis-a-vis the original expectations of the lender.  In mid-2014, a decline in international oil prices generated sharp reductions in Gabon’s oil exports and fiscal revenues. The country’s rising fiscal deficit led to the accumulation of arrears to external creditors. By 2017, the stock of the Government of Gabon’s external arrears stood at $115 million, including arrears to China, Canada, Germany, Spain, France, Israel, and South Korea. All of these arrears were successfully cleared by 2020. However, the Government of Gabon accumulated $3 million of additional arrears to Chinese creditors in 2020.  By the end of May 2021, ‘the stock of [the Government of] Gabon’s external arrears stood at CFAF 98.03 billion (US$182.1 million), including CFAF 23.8 billion (US$44.2 million) vis-à-vis multilaterals and CFAF 21.05 billion (US$39.1 million) vis-à-vis government agencies and private creditors insured with companies from Paris Club member countries and from China [ICBC and China Construction Bank] CFAF 1.3 billion (US$2.42 million). The Government's strategy for the clearance of existing external arrears consists of focusing primarily on multilateral debt, bilateral debt, insured commercial commitments and seeking agreements with other creditors prior to the IMF Board meeting. Accordingly, we will clear the arrears vis-à-vis the multilaterals. We will also clear bilateral and commercial-insured arrears as follows: (i) Austria CFAF 6.83 billion (US$12.69 million); (ii) France CFAF 11.9 billion (US$22.11 million); (iii) Israel CFAF 2.23 billion (US$4.13 million); and Spain CFAF 0.09 billion (US$0.17 million). Regarding the other commercial arrears vis-à-cis AFREXIMBANK (CFAF 7.52 billion or US$13.97 million, and commercial non-insured vis-à-vis France CFAF 0.7 billion (US$1.24 million), Austria CFAF 8.71 billion (US$16.18 million), and Morocco CFAF 1.01 billion (US$1.87 million), we contacted these creditors individually to obtain from them the non-objection agreement. The same communication was made with China to which our bilateral payment arrears are about CFAF 34.01 billion (US$63.17 million).’ Then, in 2022, the IMF reported that the Government of Gabon’s external arrears to Chinese creditors stood at $23.9 million as of December 2021 and $1 million in June 2022.
justification: Project is focused on sports infrastructure development with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of sports palace (handball stadium) with 5,493 seats, social infrastructure focus

title: China donates medical supplies to anti-cancer center in Gabon
description: On April  18, 2018, Chinese ambassador to Gabon Hu Changchun (胡长春) attended a handover ceremony for the donation of medical supplies to The Alice House (a part of Fondation Sylvia Bongo Ondimba), an anti-cancer center in Gabon. The project was completed with the delivery of the supplies at the handover ceremony on April 18, 2018.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China donates medical supplies to anti-cancer center in Gabon

# Description
On April  18, 2018, Chinese ambassador to Gabon Hu Changchun (胡长春) attended a handover ceremony for the donation of medical supplies to The Alice House (a part of Fondation Sylvia Bongo Ondimba), an anti-cancer center in Gabon. The project was completed with the delivery of the supplies at the handover ceremony on April 18, 2018.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies to healthcare facility with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical supplies donation to anti-cancer center, healthcare sector focus

title: Chinese Government provides a RMB 150 million grant - via a March 2018 ETCA - to build new medical facilities
description: On March 30, 2018, the Chinese Government and the Government of Gabon signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) in which the Chinese Government provided RMB 150 million in grant funding to Gabon to build new medical facilities. The current status of the project is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government provides a RMB 150 million grant - via a March 2018 ETCA - to build new medical facilities

# Description
On March 30, 2018, the Chinese Government and the Government of Gabon signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) in which the Chinese Government provided RMB 150 million in grant funding to Gabon to build new medical facilities. The current status of the project is unknown.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare infrastructure development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of new medical facilities using grant funding, sector explicitly identified as health

title: China donates one tractor to the rice project in Tchibanga City, Gabon
description: On December 6, 2018, Ambassador Hu Changchun in Gabon attended the ceremony of donation of a tractor to the rice project in Tchibanga City, Nyanga Province, Gabon. Lekat, the governor of Nyanga Province, led local officials, the president of the African Management University, representatives of the school’s teachers and students, and the head of the local agricultural cooperative.  Before the donation ceremony, Ambassador Hu, accompanied by the Gabonian side, inspected the rice planting situation and had a cordial exchange with the members of the cooperative to learn more about the rice output and the main problems faced.
staff_comments: Source ID (#146964) 'COOPÉRATION GABON-CHINE : L'AMBASSADE DE CHINE EN SOUTIEN À LA PRODUCTION DE RIZ ET LA PÊCHE DANS LA NYANGA' explicitly states the donation was of one tractor, while the Chinese sources imply the donation was of multiple tractors.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
China donates one tractor to the rice project in Tchibanga City, Gabon

# Description
On December 6, 2018, Ambassador Hu Changchun in Gabon attended the ceremony of donation of a tractor to the rice project in Tchibanga City, Nyanga Province, Gabon. Lekat, the governor of Nyanga Province, led local officials, the president of the African Management University, representatives of the school’s teachers and students, and the head of the local agricultural cooperative.  Before the donation ceremony, Ambassador Hu, accompanied by the Gabonian side, inspected the rice planting situation and had a cordial exchange with the members of the cooperative to learn more about the rice output and the main problems faced.
justification: Project involves agricultural donation with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of a single tractor to support rice farming, no energy-related components mentioned

title: China aids in construction of Artisanal Fisheries Center of Tchibanga City, Gabon
description: On December 6, 2018, Chinese Ambassador to Gabon Hu Changchun attended the groundbreaking ceremony of the Artisanal Fisheries Center in Tchibanga City, Nyanga Province. The deputy general secretary of the Gabonese Democratic Party, Kuba, the national secretary of Mandome, and the governor of Ganyanga Province, Lekat, accompanied nearly 300 officials from the province and local fishermen representatives.  The fishery center will be a distribution center for the processing and trade of aquatic products in the city and surrounding areas. It will also help improve the production and living conditions of local fishermen.
staff_comments: In the Chinese sources, it is clear that China 'donated' this center to Gabon ('我国援助的...'), therefore, flow type should be grant.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
China aids in construction of Artisanal Fisheries Center of Tchibanga City, Gabon

# Description
On December 6, 2018, Chinese Ambassador to Gabon Hu Changchun attended the groundbreaking ceremony of the Artisanal Fisheries Center in Tchibanga City, Nyanga Province. The deputy general secretary of the Gabonese Democratic Party, Kuba, the national secretary of Mandome, and the governor of Ganyanga Province, Lekat, accompanied nearly 300 officials from the province and local fishermen representatives.  The fishery center will be a distribution center for the processing and trade of aquatic products in the city and surrounding areas. It will also help improve the production and living conditions of local fishermen.
justification: Project focuses on fisheries development and local economic improvement without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Artisanal fisheries center, focus on processing and trade of aquatic products, improvement of local fishermen's conditions

title: Chinese Government dispatches 20th medical team to Sino-Gabonese Cooperation Hospital in Libreville and Sino-Gabonese Friendship Hospital in Franceville
description: The 20th Medical Team arrived in Gabon in July 27, 2018. The team was dispatched to Sino-Gabonese Cooperation Hospital in Libreville and Sino-Gabonese Friendship Hospital in Franceville.   On December 27, 2018, Ambassador Hu Changchun Met with President of the Gabonese embassy and the 20th batch of medical teams to aid the Franceville unit leader Sun Junjie and his party. Ambassador Hu listened to the report on the daily work of the Franceville Medical Team and the recent free clinics. He fully affirmed the hard work and boundless spirit of the medical team members, and together with Captain Sun, he promoted the improvement and enhancement of the medical assistance work in Gabon.   On August 2, 2019, the team was given awards by the Gabonese government for their service. Their term ended in late August as the 21st team arrived on August 21, 2019.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 20th medical team to Sino-Gabonese Cooperation Hospital in Libreville and Sino-Gabonese Friendship Hospital in Franceville

# Description
The 20th Medical Team arrived in Gabon in July 27, 2018. The team was dispatched to Sino-Gabonese Cooperation Hospital in Libreville and Sino-Gabonese Friendship Hospital in Franceville.   On December 27, 2018, Ambassador Hu Changchun Met with President of the Gabonese embassy and the 20th batch of medical teams to aid the Franceville unit leader Sun Junjie and his party. Ambassador Hu listened to the report on the daily work of the Franceville Medical Team and the recent free clinics. He fully affirmed the hard work and boundless spirit of the medical team members, and together with Captain Sun, he promoted the improvement and enhancement of the medical assistance work in Gabon.   On August 2, 2019, the team was given awards by the Gabonese government for their service. Their term ended in late August as the 21st team arrived on August 21, 2019.
justification: Project focuses on medical assistance and healthcare services without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team deployment, hospital operations, healthcare services

title: China donates office equipment to the Gabon Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 2018
description: In January 2018, during the visit of Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi to Gabon, the Chinese Government announced that it would provide assistance to the Government of Gabon. On August 13, 2018, the ambassador to Gabon Hu Changchun donated office supplies to the Gabon Ministry of Foreign Affairs in a handover ceremony. The Gabonese Minister of State for Foreign Affairs and Cooperation and the Minister of Francophone Affairs and the integration of regional aid signed the transfer certificate.   The information-based office equipment will help improve the administrative efficiency and office conditions of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China donates office equipment to the Gabon Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 2018

# Description
In January 2018, during the visit of Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi to Gabon, the Chinese Government announced that it would provide assistance to the Government of Gabon. On August 13, 2018, the ambassador to Gabon Hu Changchun donated office supplies to the Gabon Ministry of Foreign Affairs in a handover ceremony. The Gabonese Minister of State for Foreign Affairs and Cooperation and the Minister of Francophone Affairs and the integration of regional aid signed the transfer certificate.   The information-based office equipment will help improve the administrative efficiency and office conditions of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
justification: Project involves donation of office equipment to improve administrative efficiency, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of information-based office equipment to Gabon Ministry of Foreign Affairs, focus on improving administrative efficiency

title: China Embassy in Gabon donates books for Wenhui Library at African Management University
description: On April 24, 2018, Ambassador to Gabon Hu Changchun and Embassy diplomats attended the Chinese Culture University opening ceremony of the Chinese Cultural Salon and Wenhui Library with a donation of books. The Secretary-General of the Ministry of Agriculture of Gabon and the Chairman of the Gabonian Chinese Students Association, the head of the Asian Department of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Canada, the President of the African Management University, representatives of teachers and students of the school, and representatives of Chinese-funded enterprises attended the event.   Afterwards, Ambassador Hu unveiled the Wenhui Library. The library bears the name Wenhui, which means "the meeting of cultures" or "the gathering of scholars". He and the guests visited the exhibition of Chinese landscape and folklore paintings displayed in the bookstore. He introduced the collection of Chinese donated books to everyone and enjoyed Chinese tea together.  In addition, from 2019 onwards, the Embassy will grant two scholarships each year to the best students of the University for their studies in China.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China Embassy in Gabon donates books for Wenhui Library at African Management University

# Description
On April 24, 2018, Ambassador to Gabon Hu Changchun and Embassy diplomats attended the Chinese Culture University opening ceremony of the Chinese Cultural Salon and Wenhui Library with a donation of books. The Secretary-General of the Ministry of Agriculture of Gabon and the Chairman of the Gabonian Chinese Students Association, the head of the Asian Department of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Canada, the President of the African Management University, representatives of teachers and students of the school, and representatives of Chinese-funded enterprises attended the event.   Afterwards, Ambassador Hu unveiled the Wenhui Library. The library bears the name Wenhui, which means "the meeting of cultures" or "the gathering of scholars". He and the guests visited the exhibition of Chinese landscape and folklore paintings displayed in the bookstore. He introduced the collection of Chinese donated books to everyone and enjoyed Chinese tea together.  In addition, from 2019 onwards, the Embassy will grant two scholarships each year to the best students of the University for their studies in China.
justification: Project focuses on cultural exchange and education through book donations and scholarships, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Book donation for library, cultural exchange activities, scholarships for students

title: Chinese Embassy donates educational materials to the Sino-Gabonese Pilot School
description: On April 20, 2018, Ambassador Hu Changchun went to the Sino-Gabonese Pilot School in Libreville, Gabon, and attended the donation handover ceremony of materials and medical clinic activities. Mr. Oboli, Director of the Office of the Minister of National Education of Gabon, the head of the Hekou School District, the principal of the Sino-Gabonese Pilot School, the dean of the China-Gabon Cooperative Hospital, Liu Jie, the Economic and Commercial Counselor of the Embassy, ​​and school teachers and students attended the ceremony.  Ambassador Hu donated computers, TVs, whiteboards, and other teaching equipment and supplies to the school on behalf of the Chinese Embassy. Subsequently, Ambassador Hu announced the start of the free consultation activities of the Gabonian medical team.  In addition, during the donation, the 19th Chinese medical team to Gabon (see project ID#60600) provided free medical consultations to the students.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates educational materials to the Sino-Gabonese Pilot School

# Description
On April 20, 2018, Ambassador Hu Changchun went to the Sino-Gabonese Pilot School in Libreville, Gabon, and attended the donation handover ceremony of materials and medical clinic activities. Mr. Oboli, Director of the Office of the Minister of National Education of Gabon, the head of the Hekou School District, the principal of the Sino-Gabonese Pilot School, the dean of the China-Gabon Cooperative Hospital, Liu Jie, the Economic and Commercial Counselor of the Embassy, ​​and school teachers and students attended the ceremony.  Ambassador Hu donated computers, TVs, whiteboards, and other teaching equipment and supplies to the school on behalf of the Chinese Embassy. Subsequently, Ambassador Hu announced the start of the free consultation activities of the Gabonian medical team.  In addition, during the donation, the 19th Chinese medical team to Gabon (see project ID#60600) provided free medical consultations to the students.
justification: Project focuses on educational support and healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of educational materials and medical consultation services, no energy-related components
